item.name: Ad Astra
item.comment: A little bit like Settlers in space. Quick to play and easy to learn. Medium-depth. Nice production values and great art.

item.name: Age of Empires III: The Age of Discovery
Agricola
item.comment: Complex and interesting game with loads of replayability. It does make me feel a little claustrophobic though, as it feels like you never have enough of anything.

item.name: Airships
item.comment: Fun dice-based game. Suffiently quick-played and action-filled for its relatively high amount of luck.

item.name: Ancient Terrible Things
item.comment: Entertaining dice game with great pulpy art. Recommended!

item.name: Android
item.comment: Great theme and components but somehow it just fell flat. I think the main problem is that it feels too chaotic and random for a game of that length.

item.name: Arkadia
item.comment: Low production values, but a fun game.

item.name: Arkham Horror
item.comment: Great-looking game that oozes atmosphere. Unfortunately the wonderful Lovecraftian theme is counter-balanced by a seriously unbalanced game design in dire need of house rulings.

item.name: Ascending Empires
item.comment: Pure entertainment. Fast-playing empire building space game where you flick your spaceships across the void.

item.name: AT-43 Initiation Set: Operation Damocles
item.comment: Nice-looking pre-painted models. Like 40K with much better rules yet worse fluff. Lots of fun!

item.name: Axis & Allies Air Force Miniatures: Angels 20
item.comment: Surpringly tight set of rules and a really entertaining game. Easily the most well-designed game from the Axis & Allies franchise. The planes look good too.

item.name: Axis & Allies Miniatures
item.comment: Not sold on this one. However, my one and only play was a bit of a mess so it might deserve a higher rating.

item.name: Axis & Allies Naval Miniatures: War at Sea
BattleLore
item.comment: It's entertaining, but... it just feels a tad too complex and long for the huge amount of luck. Memoir 44 had the right idea - lots of luck but simple and quick.

item.name: Battles of Napoleon: The Eagle and the Lion
Battleship Galaxies: The Saturn Offensive Game Set
Battlestar Galactica
item.comment: Excellent game for both gamers and non-gamers. A near perfect adaptation of the tv show too. Only negative is that the core game is very meta.

item.name: Betrayal at House on the Hill
Blokus
item.comment: Great game with real nice production values.

item.name: Boss Monster: The Dungeon Building Card Game
Buffy the Vampire Slayer CCG
item.comment: As a huge Buffy fan, just the extremely well-implemented theme of the game would be enough for me. As it is, it's also actually a more than decent game.

item.name: Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Game
Call of Cthulhu: Collectible Card Game
Campaign Manager 2008
item.comment: Currently one of my favorite filler games. Almost no downtime.

item.name: Catan
item.comment: It's very... german. Wood. Thin theme. No direct conflict. It's good, but not my cup of tea.

item.name: Chaos in the Old World
item.comment: Amusing immoral theme and clever game mechanics. It's a shame that you really need exactly 4 players to get the most of it though. Only reason I haven't bought it.

item.name: Chrononauts
item.comment: Hmm. Very random and Fluxx-like. Thought I'd like it, but not so much.

item.name: Citadels
item.comment: A classic that works with both gamers and non-gamers. Not a bad gateway game.

item.name: Claustrophobia
item.comment: Oozing with theme and replayability, this is a fiendishly difficult horror game with lots of fun scenarios.

item.name: Conflict of Heroes: Storms of Steel! ‚Äì Kursk 1943
item.comment: Speaking as a non-wargamer, this turned out to be an excellent strategy game that is both easy to learn and quick to play, while simultaneously presenting a wealth of interesting choices.

item.name: Container
item.comment: Everyone I played it with LOVED it. Euro gamers and magic players both. I think the key to having fun with it is to embrace the right kind of hawker attitude when trying to swindle your friends into buying your wares.

item.name: D-Day Dice
item.comment: Highly enjoyable dice game. No need to be a war buff to get into it.

item.name: Dominion
item.comment: The theme is much too thin for my taste, but the game itself makes up for it in a big way. Easy to learn but hard to master. Short game-time too.

item.name: Dominion: Intrigue
item.comment: Great expansion. Not entirely sure it's 100% necessary, but it does add a lot if you're starting to get tired of the basic combination of the starter set.

item.name: Doom: The Boardgame
item.comment: Believe it or not, but this was my gateway game. Classic dungeon crawl in a sci-fi horror setting! Pretty ameritrashy though.

item.name: Dreamblade
item.comment: One of the best games I've ever had the pleasure of playing. Maybe THE best game. Perfectly balanced and insanely deep game that takes years to master.

item.name: Dungeon Twister
item.comment: Nice two-player game, it's basically an abstract game that masquerades as a dungeon crawl.

item.name: Firefly: The Game ‚Äì Pirates & Bounty Hunters
Firestorm Armada
item.comment: Epic space battles! Fast and furious game with great potential for memorable game sessions.

item.name: Fluxx
item.comment: We hatessss it!

item.name: Fury of Dracula (second edition)
item.comment: It might be a little too easy to catch Dracula if the players know what they're doing, but it's still a good game with fine art design and high production values.

item.name: Galaxy Trucker
item.comment: Probably one of the most stressful games I've played. In a good way! Fun, creative and exciting. Not for the faint of heart.

item.name: A Game of Thrones: The Board Game (Second Edition)
A Game of Thrones: The Card Game
Gears of War: The Board Game
Gemblo
item.comment: Feels deeper than Blokus, but somehow it lacked some of the elegance of Blokus, IMHO. I'm torn.

item.name: Hive
item.comment: One of my favorite abstracts. Gets a big plus for it's excellent durability and portability.

item.name: Horus Heresy
item.comment: Extremely fiddly and complex but at the same time incredibly thematic.

item.name: Illuminati: Deluxe Edition
item.comment: Feels a bit dated now, but still a unique and interesting game.

item.name: Incan Gold
item.comment: Nice filler that works well with non-gamers. Quite a bit of luck, but it's fast and fun.

item.name: Ingenious
item.comment: I like it, but it feels a little long for a filler game.

item.name: IRONDIE
item.comment: Features a surprising amount of interesting, hard decisions. It's a real brain burner with mind games and bluffing spicing it up. Give it a chance, it might surprise you as it did me.

item.name: Khet: The Laser Game
item.comment: Feels more gimmicky than anything. Not a bad game, but when you get past the "Oh! Lasers!" part, you realize there are better games out there.

item.name: Kill Doctor Lucky
item.comment: I like the idea of a reverse-cluedo but the game itself is just too random and not nearly balanced enough for repeat play.

item.name: King of New York
item.comment: A much-awaited upgrade to King of Tokyo. Loads of fun!

item.name: Kingdoms
item.comment: Not bad. Bit random, but that's compensated by the short playing time.

item.name: Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game
item.comment: Great production values(except for the map art) and dripping with theme. Possibly the best zombie game out there. Lots of ambiguities in the rules though. Make sure to check out the F.A.Q.

item.name: Last Will
item.comment: I have a sneaking suspicion that my spectacular ability to spend money in real life is the reason I keep winning this game.

item.name: LCR
item.comment: Seriously?! This isn't even a game, for crying out loud!

item.name: Loopin' Louie
item.comment: Makes me feel like a kid again.

item.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation (Deluxe Edition)
item.comment: Wow. This was love at first sight. The simple mechanics, yet deep gameplay thoroughly impressed me.

item.name: Magic: The Gathering
item.comment: I know lots of people still play this, but to me it just feels so 90s. I'm over it.

item.name: Mancala
item.comment: A cool alternative to backgammon or chess.

item.name: Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men
Memoir '44
item.comment: Fun, simple and quick. Lots of luck, but the game time is short enough that it doesn't matter much.

item.name: Monopoly
item.comment: The horror. The horror. The worst of the roll-and-plays. Hugely random and yet it can drag on for hours and hours.

item.name: Monsterpocalypse
item.comment: One of the most complex and tactical games I've yet to play. A real brain-burner. Plus, of course, huge monsters wrestling amongst burning buildings! What's not to like?

item.name: Monty Python Fluxx
item.comment: Fun for being Monty Python, but I think you'd have to be drunk to really like it. It's just too silly and random.

item.name: Munchkin
item.comment: Way too random. Not a fan of the art direction either. Feels like a game for kids or drunk people.

item.name: Mutant Chronicles Collectible Miniatures Game
item.comment: It's actually a pretty interesting tactical game.

item.name: Mutant Chronicles: Siege of the Citadel
Neuroshima Hex!
item.comment: Cool game with neat game mechanics, but felt a bit too random for me. Several of our games were decided by the draw of the counters.

item.name: Nexus Ops
item.comment: I'd been looking forward to trying this game for years now and was sure it wouldn't live up to my lofty expectations. But I think it may even have exceeded them! Might be the best conflict game I've played.

item.name: No Thanks!
item.comment: Fun game about bluffing and probability. Good as a light filler game.

item.name: Pandemic
item.comment: Good-looking game with a clean and clever game design. Felt like it got old quick, though. Maybe if it was a zombie outbreak instead. :-)

item.name: Pirates of the Spanish Main
item.comment: Wonderful plastic ships, but... that's about it. The rules are overly simplistic and a bit boring.

item.name: PitchCar
item.comment: So much fun! One of my favorite dexterity-based games. Too bad it weighs a ton.

item.name: Puerto Rico
item.comment: It took me years before I agreed to try this game. It just looked so dry. The game itself is an instant classic though. Deep and satisfying.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy
item.comment: Great game with a nice but somewhat thin theme. Lots of replayability.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: Rebel vs Imperium
Race for the Galaxy: The Brink of War
Race for the Galaxy: The Gathering Storm
item.comment: IMHO, the goals make the game even better.

item.name: Ricochet Robots
item.comment: This one is something of an acquired taste. It takes a few plays before you start to get into it and see the possible patterns, but then it's very satisfying.

item.name: Risk
item.comment: Too random. Too unbalanced. Not enough tactical and strategic choices.

item.name: Risk 2210 A.D.
item.comment: A HUGE improvement over Risk. Shorter game time and more interesting tactical decisions make it an excellent light war game.

item.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
RoboRally
item.comment: A perennial favorite. One of very few games that actually gets better the more players there are. Only downside is that it often feels like it takes 20-30% too long.

item.name: Rocketmen: Axis of Evil
item.comment: Tons of fun to build all the little space ships. The 50's space theme is nice and the game play is quick and simple and quite action filled.

item.name: Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
SET
item.comment: Had a lot of fun with this one. It's light, yet really needs you to kick your brain into high gear. It's the most fun when everyone's more or less at the same level, though.

item.name: Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients
Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game
Small World
item.comment: Beautiful game and novel design. A hit with both gamers and non-gamers. One of the very best gateway games.

item.name: Small World: Grand Dames of Small World
Space Hulk (third edition)
item.comment: Love this game. Dripping with claustrophobic theme. Beautiful components and well-written fluff. The game itself is tense, tactical and fascinating.

item.name: Space Hulk: Death Angel ‚Äì The Card Game
item.comment: Didn't hold up, imho. I'll stick to regular Space Hulk.

item.name: The Spoils
item.comment: Take Magic, improve the fluff, tighten up the rules and card effects a LOT, add a healthy dose of irreverent humor and you have The Spoils. It's almost embarassing how superior it is to most CCGs.

item.name: Star Wars Miniatures
item.comment: The theme is great and the rules are pretty good, but to me it's just fallen victim to the publisher being more interested in sucking our wallets dry and less about maintaining a balanced, good game. Can you say POWER CREEP?

item.name: StarCraft: The Board Game
item.comment: Not bad. Don't really like the combat but the rest is interesting. Cool game.

item.name: The Stars Are Right
item.comment: Just about the only Steve Jackson game I like. Hate the art design, but a genuinely fun game. Really wish they'd re-release it with a new design though.

item.name: Summoner Wars
item.comment: This one exceeded expectations. It's elegant, well-balanced and fun to play.

item.name: Tannh√§user
item.comment: Fiddly and complex, but intriguing and immersive.

item.name: Tannh√§user Revised Edition Rulebook
item.comment: Huge improvement over the original rules. Still not perfect though.

item.name: Thunderstone
item.comment: Not a bad game, but the monster fights feel strangely stale and boring, contrary to what the dungeon crawler theme leads one to expect. At this point in time, I would prefer Dominion.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Europe
item.comment: Fun and simple family game. A bit random maybe but with plenty of room for tactical decisions. Feels a little too simplistic for me personally, though.

item.name: Trivial Pursuit
item.comment: Bleh. Boring questions and questionable game play.

item.name: Tsuro
item.comment: First of all, it's an absolutely beautiful game. It's also very easy to learn and works great with non-gamers. Perfect filler.

item.name: Twilight Imperium (Third Edition)
item.comment: This game has been on my to-buy list for years. It's simply outstanding. But the game length is too long for most people I game with. And the cost of buying both the game and the expansion (which seems like a must) is too high if I'll never get to play it.

item.name: Twilight Imperium (Third Edition): Shattered Empire
item.comment: This game has been on my to-buy list for years. It's simply outstanding. But the game length is too long for most people I game with. And the cost of buying both the game and the expansion (which seems like a must) is too high if I'll never get to play it.

item.name: Vampire: The Eternal Struggle
item.comment: Nothing to say about this one. Like the theme.

item.name: Vikings
item.comment: Nice little snack of a game. Not bad but not great.

item.name: World of Warcraft Miniatures Game
item.comment: Great fun! Quick-played and tense with some quite clever game mechanics.

item.name: World of Warcraft: The Boardgame
item.comment: Entertaining game, but feels a little bit too ameritrashy for me. Nice theme, but there has to be a good game underneath too.

item.name: Xia: Legends of a Drift System
Z√àRTZ
item.comment: Really beautiful game with innovative mechanics. It can be very unforgiving to a beginner though. Feels more like a series of puzzles than actual moves against you opponent sometimes.

item.name: Zombies!!!
item.comment: You get a lot of zombie figures and a pretty badly designed game. There are plenty of rules variants out there, but why bother.
